name: 315 Restaurant & Wine Bar
address: 315 Old Santa Fe Trail Santa Fe, NM  87501
review description: My French husband and I truly appreciated the French flair of the restaurant as well as the food itself and the presentation! We had the duck and the lamb, followed by the creme brulee and the pots de creme, and shared all with each other. The duck and the lamb were outstanding paired together, as well as the desserts! I would actually suggest them as pairings in a single dish for the menu. We originally were going to have the beef, which was mentioned on the specials board, but were surprised to learn upon requesting it to the waitstaff, that it would take 40 minutes to prepare, even rare, which is our preference. It would have been nice to have this mentioned on the board as well as the menu.

name: Alto Lakes Golf & Country Club
review description: Seafood night is outstanding and a favorite of club members.

name: Andiamo! A Neighborhood Trattoria
review description: It would be nice if they had a better choice of beers to go along with the large wine list.

name: Artichoke Cafe
review description: Very nice, good food, good service, however, too noisy

name: Azur
address: 428 Agua Fria St. Santa Fe, NM  87501
review description: Very cool little restaurant, eclectic menu, intriguing fusion combinations, friendly and knowledgable serving staff -- look forward to going again. And again! Reasonably priced for Santa Fe.

name: Black Angus Steakhouse - Albuquerque
review description: Dale our waiter is outstanding and the reason we come back every month.

name: Blades' Bistro
review description: My husband and I enjoyd a wonderful dinner - best mushroom soup and flan tasted in a long time. All the food was delicious.

name: Brasserie La Provence
review description: Food & service was good...issue w/ flys buzzing around the table

name: Buca di Beppo - Albuquerque
review description: Our waiter, Austin, was awesome. Very friendly and helpful and made our dining experience enjoyable. Food was also great!

name: The Compound Restaurant
review description: This restaurant continues to be one of the best tables in Santa Fe!

name: Cosmo Tapas Restaurant
review description: Great service and Travis took car of us very well!

name: Coyote Cafe
address: 132 West Water Street Santa Fe, NM  87501
review description: Food and service was excellent. We were celebrating a birthday and the Coyote Cafe made it special. The sign of a great restaurant is their willingness to take extra steps to make special occasions even better. Thank you, Coyote Cafe!

name: De La Tierra at El Monte Sagrado Resort - Kessler
review description: We were guests at the resort and decided to dine here on our first night since it was easy. Overall the food was good. Be aware that the portion sizes are more than adequate, even for the small plates. I had elk that was outstanding -- probably the best I've ever had. We had appetizers that were nice and my wife's entree was good too. On the negative side, the entrees were brought out before we had finished our appetizers. The wine we ordered was not at the right temperature - they did warn us of this to be fair and attempted to chill it, but that took awhile. I think any wine offered should be available at the proper temperature. The service was friendly. Overall, no big complaints and quality food, just not great from a service view.

name: Desert Fish
review description: We were very pleased overall. Great desserts!

name: Dinner for Two
address: 106 N. Guadalupe St. Santa Fe, NM  87501
review description: Service was very marginal. Could have been better. The good was good though. Slightly disapointed because it came so highly recommended I expected more.

name: El Farol
review description: We were in Santa Fe for a month and ate there 4 times, so obviously we like it. All the waitstaff do a good job, but the hostesses are really outstanding in accommodating our seating requests.

name: El Meze Restaurant
address: 1017 Paseo Del Pueblo Norte Taos, NM  87529
review description: Food and service was excellent. It also has one of the best views in Taos. There is a good menu selection for carnivores but may need a few vegetarian entrees.

name: Epazote
address: 416 Agua Fria St Santa Fe, NM  87501
review description: Was good last time we were able to find it open.

name: Farm & Table
review description: Nice experience -- excellent food, superb wait staff.

name: Forque
review description: Great lunch selection. Was able to obtain the small private room for a special business lunch. Service was great and staff attentive.

name: Fuego @ La Posada de Santa Fe
address: 330 East Palace Ave Santa Fe, NM  87501
review description: Little on the expensive side, for what you get - but very tasty food. Filet mignon was great.Lovely wines and delicious desserts. Worth a stroll around the hotel to absorb the history and look at the art.

name: Galisteo Bistro
review description: Fantastic, as usual. Love the folksy nature of the dishes and the high quality of the ingredients.

name: Geronimo
review description: I've dined at Geronimo's for the last 10 years and never a bad meal or service. Never!!

name: Graham's Grille
address: 106 Paseo Del Pueblo Norte Taos, NM  87571
review description: Enjoyed a good meal and a reasonably priced bottle of good winefor a decent price. Graham's grille serves three meals a day and is one of the nicer establishments in Tao's.

name: High Finance  Restaurant - At the top of the Tram
review description: The ride up was amazing. The sunset was beautiful. Thinking about it now I wonder if they're open for breakfast? Sunrise from the other side of the restaurant is probably breathtaking as well.

name: Il Piatto
address: 95 West Marcy Street Santa Fe, NM  87501
review description: Outstanding food. Excellent service. Since we went before 6 p.m., all of the appetizers, salads, pastas, and wines by the glass were half price, which was an added bonus. Loved the squid ink pasta, heirloom tomato gazpacho, arugula salad with apples, and gorgonzola ravioli. Will definitely come back.

name: Indigo Crow
review description: Very thick steaks that were not cooked very well. But they fixed it. Allowed substitutions. Friendly service staff.Somewhat pricy. Overall a good dining experience.

name: Inn Of The Anasazi
review description: Sea bass was tasty with beautiful presentation while Scallop entree was disappointing.Although we did not stay in the Anasazi hotel, service and meal experience was not what we expected from a Rosewood property.

name: La Boca
address: 72 West Marcy Street Santa Fe, NM  87501
review description: some of our group arrived a few minutes early and the table was ready. one in the party has a service dog, and the dog and his owner were treated with respect. 4 of the 6 were from out of town, and they loved it. we locals do, too, and we will return often. thank you very much.

name: La Cantina
address: 125 East Palace Avenue Santa Fe, NM  87501
review description: I love thIs place. The food is always great and the singing service is fabulous.

name: La Casa Sena
address: 125 East Palace Avenue Santa Fe, NM  87501
review description: A special place for a wonderful brunch.

name: La Plazuela at La Fonda on the Plaza
address: 100 E. San Francisco Street Santa Fe, NM  87501
review description: The restaurant was very busy when we arrived and we had to wait 25 minutes for our table. Too bad as usually La Plazuela is perfect service and wonderful food.

name: Las Fuentes Restaurant & Bar
address: 1297 Bishops Lodge Rd Santa Fe, NM  87501
review description: Continues the Bishop's Lodge reputation for quiet elegance. Sunday Brunch was outstanding.

name: Los Equipales
review description: It is not often you can find a better restaurant like Los Equipales to dine individually, as a couple, or as a small or large group, and you can make reservations! Here you will experience warm, friendly hospitality, excellent service, candlelight, linen covered tables, and delicious Mexican Crusine. It is a great place for special occasions or for lunch or a dinner night out inside or out on the patio. Erika is the owner and will always greet you with her special smile.

name: Lucia at Andaluz Hotel
review description: Lucia is an absolute treasurer for dinner. Also uses a lot of local foods and the it is excellent. The service and food were a great pairing. THe wine list they are working on but has potential. It is very modern in atmosphere.

name: Luminaria Restaurant & Patio
address: 211 Old Santa Fe Trail Santa Fe, NM  87501
review description: Patio dining was delightful.Early bird special dinner was well worth the cost - all dishes were very flavorful and presented well.Would return on our next trip to Santa Fe

name: The Melting Pot - Albuquerque
address: 2201 Uptown Loop NE Suite 1A Albuquerque, NM  87110
review description: The space, the service, the food: AWESOME!

name: Mucho Gusto
address: 839 Paseo De Peralta Santa Fe, NM  87501
review description: It is definitely a locals place. If you enjoy food, then you must try "The Bomb". The only draw back was the lack of a full liquor license wich ment no margarita with great food.

name: Nob Hill Bar & Grill
review description: Great Bar & Grill food with a gourmet spin! The Basil Caesar Salad was deliciously savory with added texture from the bacon lardons and crispy croutons. The basil was not overpowering, just a light background note. Soup of the day was carrot coconut curry. Yum! The delicious burger brought back warm memories of eating a juicy homemade burger as a kid. I was skeptical of the Blueberry Pie with the corn meal crust but it delivered on texture and taste. I can't wait to have it again! Service was awesome too!

name: The Old House Restaurant
address: 309 West San Francisco Street Santa Fe, NM  87501
review description: good old days at the old house..... way to go santa fe

name: Osteria D' Assisi
address: 58 S. Federal Place Santa Fe, NM  87501
review description: The sea bass special was phenomenal. I was blown away by the use of local heirloom tomatoes in the sauce. Also had the beet appetizer - roasted to perfection and surprisingly paired with cucumbers and radishes. Refreshing and delicious. I will definitely visit this restaurant again. The only suggestion I would make is to spiff up the white wines by the glass. How about a verdicchio and a sauvignon blanc?

name: The Palace Restaurant and Saloon
address: 142 W. Palace Ave Santa Fe, NM  87501
review description: We chose this venue in order to try their patio. It was very pleasant with only a few tables in use. I noticed a very nice room inside that presumably is available for a group. Inside looks like a good place to be deemed "romantic" however months ago when we ate inside the bar noise would have negated that. It seemed very much a "hot spot" that evening. I understand that this noise has been corrected. The patio is more "friendly" than "romantic".

name: Pars Cuisine
review description: Very good middle-eastern menu. Enjoyed the spanakopita and stuffed grape leaves. Meat skewers were well done, and the Turkish coffee was a nice endto our meal.

name: Prairie Star Restaurant
address: 288 Prairie Star Rd Santa Ana Pueblo, NM  87004
review description: Always love coming here-beautiful view, stellar service, great food and wine list with a bar that is loaded with premium drinks. If you're looking for a first class experience, this is it.

name: Pranzo Italian Grill
review description: the food was excellent as was the service. we made sure to come when David Geist was playing upstairs. we had a perfect evening of fine dining and great music.

name: Raaga
address: 544 B Agua Fria Unit B Santa Fe, NM  87501
review description: Very sweet helpful staff. We found the food very rich . WE were hoping for a lighter style of Indian food. We had a delicious Mahi Mahi.Intimate small & cheerful.

name: Rancher's Club of New Mexico
review description: The Ranchers Club is an old favorite. It is just too "staugy" to go more often than once every two years. The service is very good but at times it seems too much attention as everyone stops by the table to see if everything is OK. We have experience eating out and can get the wait staff attention if needed. We related the pesky attention to a nurse coming in your hospital room at 4 AM to draw blood. As for the food, we always find the menu interesting. The decor could use an update swank western touch.

name: Red Sage Restaurant
address: Hilton Santa Fe/Buffalo Thunder Resort 20 Buffalo Thunder Trail Santa Fe, NM  87506
review description: Tortilla soup and salmon were outstanding. The modern decor is tasteful, but as tables fill, the sound level bounces, making quiet conversations difficult.

name: Restaurant Martin
review description: This restaurant is just right. The food is wonderful, the staff attentive and it was bustling without being noisy.

name: Ristra Restaurant
address: 548 Agua Fria Street Santa Fe, NM  87501
review description: Continues to be a favorite for a romantic dinner!

name: Sabroso
review description: This out-of-the-way restaurant is well worth the trip. Great ambiance in an quiet location at the foot of the mountains sets the stage for a very enjoyable evening, capped off with an excellent meal with many choices. The service was outstanding as the staff really made you feel welcomed.

name: San Q Japanese Sushi & Tapas
review description: Fresh, delicious sushi in Santa Fe. We were looking for a nice light dinner before a concert. This was perfect. And a special treat as well...it was my husband's birthday, which I had noted on the reservation. I had hoped for a special table, which we were given, but the hostess and waitress also brought out a nice dessert with a candle, and did their very best "Happy Birthday from San Q".

name: Sandiago's Mexican Grill
review description: Everything was almost wonderful, I had made a reservation for 4 with a table with a view, we got to the restaurant and our table was not ready, but the one they wanted to give us was inside without any kind of view, I told the hostess I had resevered it with this special request, and she said we would we would have to wait for a bit while the next table became available because they got so busy, to me that's why we made a reservation, but other than that it was great.

name: Savoy Bar and Grill Albuquerque
review description: Somewhat eclectic menu. Limited choices. Dessert was great; had the semi fro with mango and strawberries.

name: Scalo
review description: Food and service was good. On a funny note, we were the only non anglo people in the restaurant!

name: Seasons Rotisserie & Grill
address: 2031 Mountain Road San Felipe Plaza Albuquerque, NM  87104
review description: We have eaten many times at Seasons before, and usually had excellent food and service. But Sunday night was quiet (which is great) with only a few diners. However, requests for a missing napkin when unheeded as did three requests to two different wait staff for butter instead of olive oil. The griddle cakes came out burnt, the chicken dry. It was sad. We wondered who was in the kitchen.

name: St. Clair Winery & Bistro
review description: Had a great overall experience! It was my first time eating there but I will certainly go back!

name: Tabla de Los Santos
address: 210 Don Gaspar Avenue Santa Fe, NM  87501
review description: Food was fantastic. Wait staff seemed inexperienced. Apologized frequently. Not all wine on wine list was available. We were the only ones in the dining room on a Friday night - some outside diners, but not many.

name: Tanti Luce 221
review description: Improved food w/ well prepared halibut and a very tasty paella. The smelt were crisp and flavorful and the salad properly dressed and fresh. It was our 4th visit and we hope they continue to build upon the improvements made so far. Good luck!

name: Terra @ Four Seasons Resort Rancho Encantado
review description: Terra is in the process of changing from Auberge to Four Seasons, and the restaurant unfortunately reflects the process. The front desk informed us when we inquired that the executive chef left in the changeover, and that there is apparently an interim chef in place. The menu now is different, there were no specials, and there was no soup available! We had guests up from Albuquerque, and they were somewhat dissapointed after we had hyped the restaurant so much. Service as usual was great, but the food was not what we expected. Now, we ourselves hadn't been to Terra for several months since we were out of town, but we're on their e-mail list and there was no warning of the changeover. We'll monitor Terra and hope things improve.

name: Terra American Bistro
review description: I was anxious to try their revised menu but my dining experience was fair, at best. My server did not ask if we wanted wine; she was too anxious to take our food order. I had to request a bottle of wine, then I had to ask for an ice bucket. My companion order spaghetti al vongole - there was much too much sauce, so the pasta was swimming. The clams were tender. I ordered pasta pomodoro .. the pasta was gummy as if it had been sitting for a long time under a heat lamp. It was also overcooked. I won't write them off yet, but I was very disappointed.

name: Tomme
review description: The food here was very tasty and well served and presented. The only negative is that the outdoormre needs. Good cleaning nd spruce up. It felt very neglected and a bit run down. If they fixed up the patio I would have felt better there.

name: Trombino's Bistro Italiano
review description: Wonderful food service was excellent highly recommended

name: Vanessie
address: 434 W. San Francisco Santa Fe, NM  87501
review description: The restaurant is okay. Wine list is nice and decently priced. It is more interesting for the bar scene and the music. Very nice wait staff.

name: Vernon's Hidden Valley Steakhouse
address: 6855 4th Street NW Los Ranchos De Albuquerque, NM  87107
review description: Everything was excellent. This was our first time to Vernon's and we just loved it. I could not have been happier with our experience. We were there celebrating my fiance's birthday and we had an amazing time. We will definitely be back and telling all our friends about our experience!

name: Zinc Wine Bar & Bistro
review description: Really great food and a great experience all round. however we did notice them squeezing groups of 6 into booths that are probably better for 4 people. we were a foursome on a table and it was perfect.
